text: Viriat is a commune in the Ain department of eastern France. ==History== Settlement there goes back to at least the Celtic period. In the twelfth century, the name "Viriacus" appears in a record, referring to church and a priory. ==Population== ==Twin towns== Viriat is twinned with: * Voinești, Vaslui, Romania, since 1989 * Sorbolo, Italy, since 2000 ==See also== *Communes of the Ain department ==External links== * Official website Category:Communes of Ain Category:Bresse Category:Ain communes articles needing translation from French Wikipedia
title: Viriat
